title: (x) Late Night with Conan O’Brien - Pixie {David H}
content: Fellow employee’s brother’s wife wants to know what the name of the typeface is being used by [Late Night with Conan O’Brien](http://web.archive.org/web/20070317072405/http:/www.nbc.com/Late_Night_with_Conan_O'Brien/index.shtml). I know I know this one. :^/
author: Miss Tiffany

comments.content: argh… it’s that one that looks like spumoni and isn’t… on the tip of my tongue too.

Do you mean this, Tiff?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/files/Conan_type.jpg)

Looks very similar to Stymie, but more monoline.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/files/Stymie1.png)
I think she’s referring to the jaunty bodoni-esque font for the Late Night logo. The one that’s not quite spumoni.
I think this is free or bundle or something… I don’t remember; the same as the movie Serendipity (2001)

Oh, you mean this —

 ![](http://web.archive.org/files/Conan_title.png)

I usually keep my web security settings set high so I don’t always see all animation and flash files.

Yep - Pixie. Digitized by David Rakowski as [Pixie](http://web.archive.org/web/20070317072405/http:/www.faces.co.uk/fonts/fontview.cfm?productsku=IN20079) and by Panache Graphics as [Heatwave](http://web.archive.org/web/20070317072405/http:/www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.htm?pid=418103&grab_id=0&page_id=9375&query=heatwave).

FYI — the old twentieth century lettering term for bouncy baseline informal alphabets was [Frisky](http://web.archive.org/web/20070317072405/http:/www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=frisky&source=MyFonts.com&page=1) which still seems to work well if used as a search term on MyFonts.com
